title: Dynamic tab name
author: cwi-ezoutas
body_snippet:
It would be very useful to have dynamic tab naming for ssh connections.
Example:
1) Connect to "Server A" as user "testor" where hostname is "servera"
2) Tab should be named "testor@servera (Server A)"
3) SSH from "Server A" to another server at IP 192.168.1.2 with user "test"
4) Tab should be named "test@192.168.1.2 (Server A)"

This is extremely useful when you manage hundred of servers.
This is the same with:
https://mremoteng.atlassian.net/browse/MR-571

Could not find the same ti...

comments.snippet:
Step 4 is currently not possible without significantly changing PuTTY.

We may be able to look into this once PuTTY is replaced by SSH.Net (#181)
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: I don't know if it helps, but SuperPutty does that with the original Putty in it's backend.
comments.author: cwi-ezoutas

comments.snippet: We can take a look and see how they did it - thanks for the tip.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: Ok, I see how they did it now. I forgot that putty changes the window name automatically when the current host changes. We should be able to do this fairly easily
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: Hi, I have downloaded v1.76.11 and I am still not able to change the title dynamically by changing the PS1 similar to SuperPutty or Putty. Is this feature available in mRemoteNg? I really like to use mRemoteNG.
comments.author: rk36912

comments.snippet: This feature is being developed for v1.77
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: It will be great to see all changes in putty winodw name, for example when I use portmaseter on freebsd to upgrade my ports, with putty I can see at which step it is at the moment (5/9 i.e. 5 done, 9 total)
comments.author: Ishayahu

comments.snippet:
Hi, 

Any progress on this? 1.77 is still in prerelease since , Apr 29, 2019
Can you pls backport this feature to 1.76?

Thanks.
comments.author: zsbolyoczki

comments.snippet: hello, unfortunately we are moving forward and its a lot of changes in 1.77.x version including .Net 6 framework... so please wait for a new stable release of 1.77
comments.author: Kvarkas
